sentences: Ma polnud põtra varem nii lähedalt näinud.
Seeni leidsime lepikust suure kivi lähedalt.
context: The word 'lähedalt' is an adverb in Estonian with two main meanings: 1) indicating a short distance (from nearby, close up), and 2) referring to a short time interval. It's the ablative singular form of läheda. In physical contexts, it describes something happening at a short distance away, as in 'they came from nearby.' In temporal contexts, it can mean 'recently' or 'not long ago,' as in examples from history.
